methods.name: Storage
methods.description:
To access your Cloud Storage buckets, you will use the bucket function returned from this storage object.

The example below will demonstrate the different usage patterns your app may need to connect to gcloud and access your bucket.

methods.name: Bucket
methods.description: Create a Bucket object to interact with a Google Cloud Storage bucket.

params.name: options.keyFilename
params.description: - Full path to the JSON key downloaded from the Google Developers Console. Alternatively, you may provide a credentials object.

params.name: options.credentials
params.description: - Credentials object, used in place of a keyFilename.

params.name: query.delimiter
params.description: - Results will contain only objects whose names, aside from the prefix, do not contain delimiter. Objects whose names, aside from the prefix, contain delimiter will have their name truncated after the delimiter, returned in prefixes. Duplicate prefixes are omitted.

params.name: query.prefix
params.description: - Filters results to objects whose names begin with this prefix.

params.name: query.maxResults
params.description: - Maximum number of items plus prefixes to return.

params.name: query.pageToken
params.description: - A previously-returned page token representing part of the larger set of results to view.

methods.name: copy
methods.description: Copy an existing file. If no bucket name is provided for the destination file, the current bucket name will be used.

params.name: metadata.bucket
params.description: - Destination bucket for the file. If none is provided, the source's bucket name is used.

exceptions.description: the destination filename is not provided.

params.name: name
params.description: - Name of the file to remove.

methods.name: getSignedUrl
methods.description:
Get a signed URL to allow limited time access to a resource.

{@link https://developers.google.com/storage/docs/accesscontrol#Signed-URLs}

params.name: options.contentMd5
params.description: - The MD5 digest value in base64. If you provide this, the client must provide this HTTP header with this same value in its request.

params.name: options.contentType
params.description: - If you provide this value, the client must provide this HTTP header set to the same value.

params.name: options.expires
params.description: - Timestamp (seconds since epoch) when this link will expire.

params.name: options.extensionHeaders
params.description: - If these headers are used, the server will check to make sure that the client provides matching values.

methods.name: createReadStream
methods.description: Create a readable stream to read contents of the provided remote file. It can be piped to a write stream, or listened to for 'data' events to read a file's contents.

methods.name: createWriteStream
methods.description: Create a duplex stream to handle the upload of a file.

params.name: name
params.description: - Name of the remote file to create.

methods.name: write
methods.description: Write the provided data to the destination with optional metadata.

params.name: name
params.description: - Name of the remote file to create.

params.name: options.data
params.description: - Data to save to the file.
